title: Sri Lanka US$400mn swap rolled over by Reserve Bank of India
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – India has rolled over a 400 million US dollar swap to Sri Lanka’s central bank, the country’s High Commission in Colombo said.
India’s unstinted and multi-faceted support to Sri Lanka continued,” the High Commission said in twitter.com message.
“As ongoing currency support, Reserve Bank of India has extended the duration of the US$ 400 million currency swap the Central Bank of Sri Lanka which was concluded in January this year.
Sri Lanka’s central bank started borrowing from other central banks and the market through swaps as reserves were lost due to money printed to keep rates down.
India has separately given money to import oil and medicines amid acute foreign exchange shortages, coming from a soft-pegged central banks.

Sri Lanka’s economists have printed money under various pretexts, delayed market rate rises through various monetary instruments and triggered currency crises for 72 years and blamed them on budget deficits and imports.
